ANXIETY OF THE ABIPONES CONCERNING THE REVENGE OF THE TOEAS. CONTAGION OF THE TERTIAN FEVER.

MV Abipones, late the conquerors of the To- baS, were not ignorant that their vanquished enemies observed the same rule as themselves in revenging injuries, and that victories were often succeeded by bloody slaughters. 'That they might not, therefore, be surprized by a sudden incursion of the TobaS, whom they had recently provoked, they diligently fortified their tents by the erection of temporary fences.
